questions.question: When you are working with a Sitecore.Data.Items.Item object, which method should you use to get a list of all its children?
questions.feedback: The GetChildren() method returns a list of an item's children in the form of a ChildList collection.

questions.question: What is a Sitecore item?

answerOptions.option: A page the visitor views on the website
An entity storing the information used to find the content in the file system
A definition for the type of date that you want to store
A definition for the type of date that you want to store

questions.feedback: A Sitecore item is what Sitecore uses to store data.

questions.question: When you patch in changes to the Sitecore.config file, how can you control the order in which your changes are applied?

answerOptions.option: In App_Config/, create <order> entries in the Sitecore.Patch.config file
In App_Config/Include, use a naming convention and sub-folders for config files
In Web.Config, manually insert the changes in order
In Web.Config, manually insert the changes in order

questions.feedback: Recommended practice is to use the App_Config/Include folder, where folders and files are loaded alphabetically.
